channel.title: Non Standard Evaluation on The Working R Programmer
channel.description: Recent content in Non Standard Evaluation on The Working R Programmer

item.title: Environments and formulae
item.description: In my two previous posts on non-standard evaluation, Scoping rules and NSE and Overscoping and eval, I explained: How R finds the bindings of variables by looking through chains of environments.

item.title: Overscoping and eval
item.description: In my previous post I used the lm function for an example of scope rules, but I left a few details out. I didn’t want to muddy the example with too many details, so I chose to lie a little.

item.title: Scoping Rules and NSE
item.description: Earlier this week, I wrote some tweets about how you have to be careful about scopes when you do “non-standard evaluation”. I cover this in both Metaprogramming in R and Domain-Specific Languages in R, but this tweet
